Did you get my entry? I sent it from my official SA Archives Citadel  address 
on Friday. I still haven't gotten an acknowledgement of its receipt and  the 
deadline is quickly approaching.
 
Nina
---------------------------------
In a message dated 7/13/2008 10:01:17 A.M. Eastern Daylight Time,  
samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com writes:
 
 
 
 

This is an automated reminder about the 2008 Samurai Fiction  contest.

Deadline for entrance fee: 7/15/2008 
NO Entrance  fee.

Check the site for complete information:
_http://www.samurai-http://wwhttp://www.sahttp_ 
(http://www.samurai-archives.com/writcon2.html) 

This  year there is NO FEE to enter the samurai fiction contest. The contest 
is  completely free and open to all. The entries will be published on Samurai  
Archives.com, with the winner featured. Writers will retain all rights to  
their stories.

Fourth Annual Samurai Fiction Contest, 2008

The  parameters for the third annual Samurai Fiction contest are covered on 
this  page. The stories must involve Japan or the Samurai, and the story may 
take  place any time up to, but no later than the end of the 19th century, and 
may  take place at any point in Japanese history before  this.

Requirements:

This is to be a piece of fiction writing  taking place within an unspecified 
period in Japanese history up to the late  19th century. The available genres 
are listed on the website, linked above -  the stories must be written in the 
style of one of the genres on the  listed.

Parameters:

The story is required to be more than 1,000  words, with a 5,000 word 
targeted limit - overages are acceptable if  necessary, but please don't overdo it. 
It can be done in the first person, or  the third person, and must be a 
complete short story, not an excerpt from a  larger story. The genre(s) must be 
listed at the top of the story above the  title - one genre or a combination of two 
genres are acceptable. Although the  particular genre will not affect 
judging, all entrants must make sure that  their story follows the requirements of 
their chosen genre(s) - see details on  the website listed above.

Sequels: Sequels to previous stories entered  in the contest are acceptable - 
however, the story must be a stand-alone short  story, not a continuation of 
the previous story.

Submission  Information:

Submissions are to be sent via email to webmaster @  
samurai-archives.Submissions are to be sent via email to webmaster @  samurai-archives.<WBR>com in a 
WORD .Doc format OR HTML. At the top of the  first page, please include your 
full name, your Yahoo ID, Samurai Archives  Citadel ID, and your Delphi Forums 
ID (whichever is applicable) your email  address, as well as the genre(s) the 
story falls under, and the title of your  story. You

Judging and Winning the contest:

Submissions will be  judged by a panel of Yahoo Group and Samurai Citadel 
community members who are  not submitting stories. The judges will not be told 
who the authors of each  respective submission are until after the judging has 
closed, to avoid any  swaying of the judges. The recipient of the submissions 
(The Samurai Archives  webmaster) will not be a judge, and will only moderate 
the proceedings, to  keep entries anonymous. The winning story will be featured 
on the Samurai  Archives site as the winner of the 2008 Samurai Fiction 
contest. All stories  will be placed in the 'Fan Fiction' section of the Samurai 
Archives as well.  The winner will be announced at the Yahoo Group and the 
Samurai Citadel at the  end of judging. 

Participants agree to have their stories displayed on  that Samurai Archives 
after the contest has finished. Participants will retain  all rights to their 
work, and will be credited for their work on the site.  

Please email questions to webmaster @ samurai-archives.Please e

Deadline for fiction submission: 7/15/2008
Judging starts:  7/20/2008
Judging ends: 8/01/2008 or until necessary
Winner to be  announced after judging.

Timelines are subject to change.  

Enjoy!
